conbody.p: So let's tie it together. The http function gives you access to the streaming interface (i.e., it returns a Response using a BufferedSource) while httpLbs returns a lazy ByteString. Both of these return values in the ResourceT transformer so that they can access the Manager and have connections handled properly in the case of exceptions.
Here are a bunch of random comments about the library. Consider it the FAQ. Likewise, if you have a question, please ask it so that this section can be updated.

dlentry.dt: How do I ignore the remainder of a response body without reading it?
dlentry.dd: Use bsourceClose on the responseBody record.
